Job Posting:163038 - Position: S25 Robotics Automation Application / Full Stack Engineer 163038 E3 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/26/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/22/2025 10:12 AM Expired ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Zebra Technologies Mississauga, Ontario - Psion 2100 Meadowvale Blvd Mississauga L5N 7J9 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Robotics Automation Application / Full Stack Engineer 163038 E3 Co-op Position San Jose, CA USA 8 months US 27.6 per hour for 0 Major List USD 27.60 - USD 35.08 Hourly Job Title: 2025 Summer Internship (US) - Robotics Automation Application / Full Stack Engineer Job ID: 107410 Salary: USD 27.60 - USD 35.08 Hourly Overview: At Zebra, we are a community of innovators who come together to create new ways of working to make everyday life better. United by curiosity and care, we develop dynamic solutions that anticipate our customer's and partner's needs and solve their challenges. Being a part of Zebra Nation means being seen, heard, valued, and respected. Drawing from our diverse perspectives, we collaborate to deliver on our purpose. Here you are a part of a team pushing boundaries to redefine the work of tomorrow for organizations, their employees, and those they serve. You have opportunities to learn and lead at a forward-thinking company, defining your path to a fulfilling career while channeling your skills toward causes that you care about - locally and globally. We've only begun reimaging the future - for our people, our customers, and the world. Let's create tomorrow together. The purpose of this internship is to prepare college students for entry into the business world by providing a thorough understanding of the various functions of the Zebra Technologies organization. The program is designed to provide you with a full experience so that you can fully envision a career with Zebra. You will be positioned for success with training, exposure to all parts of the business, social activities, a professional mentor relationship and development sessions to help you discover your own performance edge! Zebra Robotics Automation Applications team builds all front facing UX and backend APIs to support our Fulfillment and Material Movement solutions for Autonomous Mobile Robots. Our software includes a real time map that displays location and sensor information for robots and APIs that interface to both internal and external customers This is intern role is a hybrid opportunity based in San Jose, CA and will be working onsite a minimum of 3 days a week. Zebra does not offer relocation or housing budget. Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a permanent basis without requiring sponsorship now or in the future Responsibilities: • Develop planning, organizational and leadership skills • Increase technology knowledge and skills • Develop team-based work proficiencies Develop interpersonal skills to connect with day-to-day business contacts through follow up activities • As a Summer Intern in the Robotics Automation application/ Full Stack team, you will be responsible for the following - • Select from a set of relevant projects for Summer 2025 related to our work on our robotic Fulfillment solution. Our solution centers on enabling warehouse customers to automate picking of orders to ship to customers. We use cloud services, handheld devices, and Autonomous Mobile robots so your work will provide you with broad exposure to our stack. US Summer Internship Benefits: • Summer Fridays, As Applicable with Your Team • 30+ Social and Professional Events in 12 Weeks Global Immersion with Your Teams and Interns • Job Requirements Qualifications: Minimum Qualifications: • Current enrollment in an undergraduate degree program in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or graduate degree program in Computer Engineering/ Computer Science. • Must have an anticipated graduation date between May 2025-December 2026 for undergraduate degree programs and 2025 to 2026 for graduate degree programs. • Experience/ Prior internship in Full Stack Development and experience with JavaScript is required. • Must be authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship now or in the future Must be able to work in the San Jose, CA office a minimum of three days a week. • Preferred Qualifications: • Experience in Full stack development using React / React Native, Golang and Async programming is highly desired. • Experience with databases like SQL/ Postgres SQL or Redis will be highly desired. • Ability to work with and understand complex systems will be highly desired. Good communicator, self-motivated, and critical thinking skills • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://careers.zebra.com/careers/job/343622891533 Indicate your interest to apply to this position in SCOPE and also submit your application package via the online website portal. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may expire at any time. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
